evaluationTitle: Preliminary Threat Assessment: Unauthorized Drone Activity Disrupting Commercial Air Traffic

threatEvent.eventDescription: Unauthorized drone operation resulting in flight delays, diversions, or potential near-miss incidents with commercial aircraft.

adversary.perpetratorIdentity: Unknown; potential scenarios include recreational drone operators, malicious actors, or accidental intrusions.
motivations: Recreational activity with disregard for regulations
Espionage or surveillance targeting airport infrastructure
Accidental loss of control or navigational error

capability.technicalExpertise: Variable; ranging from novice drone users to individuals with advanced technical skills for modifying drone hardware/software.
capability.resourcesAvailable: Dependent on perpetrator; ranging from commercially available drones to custom-built platforms with enhanced capabilities.

victimEntity.targetName: Commercial Air Traffic; Specifically Flights XYZ123, ABC456, and QRS789 affected on 2024-10-27
victimEntity.targetLocation: Within 5 nautical miles of [Airport Name] airspace
criticalAssetsAtRisk: Reputation of airlines and airport authorities

methodOfAttack.intrusionVector: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) operating within restricted airspace
attackActions: Potential radio frequency interference with aircraft navigation systems (less likely)

location.altitude: Variable, observed at approximately 400-1000 feet above ground level

potentialConsequences: Diversion of flights to alternative airports
Potential for mid-air collision (low probability, but high impact)
Damage to aircraft or airport infrastructure
Loss of life (very low probability, but potentially catastrophic)
Financial losses for airlines and airport authorities

recommendedMitigations: Enhanced drone detection and tracking systems
Geofencing technology to prevent drones from entering restricted airspace
Increased public awareness campaigns regarding drone regulations
Collaboration with law enforcement agencies to identify and apprehend perpetrators
Drone countermeasures (e.g., drone jammers, drone capture systems) - Use with extreme caution and legal authorization
Improvement of pilot situational awareness regarding drone activity
